page.title: 07H20 POLLUTION SURVEY GLASGOW
page.content: On Monday the l3th of May l985 we left the school at 9.45 a.m. with Steve and Gerry (Countryside Rangers from Pollok Park) and we made our way to the Levern Water. We were going to study the animal life and the level of pollution. We were separated into nine groups of three. Each group had a large and small net, a tub and a nature viewer. The class managed to catch a lot; - Water louse, Sludge worms, pondskaters, silver diving beetles, sticklebacks, leeches, snails, water mites, water boatmen, frogs, blood worms, and snails eggs. The level of pollution was C which is quite polluted. The possible causes of pollution in the water were oil, sewage, plastic, footballs, iron and rust. (Part of Glasgow Wildlife Week).
